title: Timeline of investigations into Donald Trump and Russia (January–June 2019)
added: ** Corsi and Klayman file a lawsuit against Caputo and Stone that, in part, accuses Stone of using Caputo as a mouthpiece to evade his judicial gag order.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Conservative figures sue Caputo, saying he served as Stone's mouthpiece |url=https://buffalonews.com/news/local/conservative-figures-sue-caputo-saying-he-served-as-stones-mouthpiece/article_ce18a0be-6e05-54cf-9928-fe2177cd0376.html |website=[[The Buffalo News]] |date=April 18, 2019 |access-date=February 21, 2021 |last=Zremski |first=Jerry}}</ref><ref>{{Cite |title=Corsi, Klayman v. Caputo, Stone |url=https://assets.documentcloud.org/documents/5798317/4-5-19-Corsi-v-Caputo-Complaint.pdf |via=[[Adobe Document Cloud]] |date=April 5, 2019 |last=Klayman |first=Larry |author-link=Larry Klayman}}</ref>

title: Timeline of investigations into Donald Trump and Russia (January–June 2019)
added: *'''May 24''': The [[Office of the Comptroller of the Currency]] bans Calk from involvlment with the Federal Savings Bank of Chicago pending the outcome of the bribery charges against him.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Banker Stephen Calk barred from industry while feds pursue bribery charges for issuing Manafort loans |url=https://www.chicagotribune.com/business/ct-biz-feds-bar-calk-bank-bribery-case-manafort-20190701-ome67hlhsvd5tpxyfx6wt6vvsa-story.html |website=[[Chicago Tribune]] |date=July 1, 2019 |access-date=March 5, 2021 |last=Channick |first=Robert}}</ref>
